newsitem.title: CANADA: Newbridge shares rise after studies.
newsitem.headline: Newbridge shares rise after studies.

text.p: Shares in Newbridge Networks Corp rose in relatively heavy trade on Wednesday after the company revealed four studies which named it as the market leader in sales of asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) wide area network (WAN) switches.
Newbridge said data industry analysis firms International Data Corp, Dataquest, Vertical Systems Group and In-Stat identified it as the leader in this market.
One portfolio manager said the studies were helping to stimulate Newbridge shares, which rose 1.65 to 82.30 in trade of 131,748 shares on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
In New York, Newbridge gained 1-1/4 to 60.
The company is also holding a technology seminar in Ottawa today with analysts and reporters.

At the conference, a senior executive revealed that Newbridge plans to take a minority equity stake in a Canadian firm that is expert in very high-speed radio frequencies that may be useful for business communications.
"Our interest is in using that two-way transmission technology for business as opposed to (using) fibre optics," executive vice president Conrad Lewis told reporters.
He declined to name the company.
Newbridge also announced a number of senior management changes and the creation of a new position, vice-president of broadband alliance.
